episodes.description: Ronnie and Adam discuss disk and volume security. They show how to implement FileVault and the options (iCloud or local) available when configuring it and keeping the recovery key. They use the terminal to ensure the the FileVault Keys are not stored in RAM while the system goes into stand by. They also discuss if FileVault will cause any issues with virtualization technology.

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie take a look at setting up mobile device security.  With the proliferation of tablets devices, they use an iPad to show some of the simple security settings an IT Professional should consider using to provide more security when helping users set these devices.  They discuss using the lockscreen, erasing the device and controlling the privacy settings.  They also demonstrate how to disable some of features that retain and even report some of the PII, personally identifiable information.

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie focus on android phone security settings. They demonstrate how to enable things like biometrics and discuss setting PINs too.  They look at some of the advanced security settings that can be enabled. They discuss the need for individuals to take time and explore these settings in order to understand what will be appropriate for them.

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie take a look at and discuss security settings that are seldom discussed, including the service provider security software packages as well as some of the advanced Android OS based settings.  Adam describes and shows some of the settings in these vendor packages.  He also emphasizes the use of encrypting the device along with the removable storage as well.

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss the need for initial Cisco device security.  With Cisco routers and switches being part of many network infrastructures, they talk about the need to do basic device configuration to secure access to these devices prior to deployment.  Using the CLI, they show how to set basic passwords for accessing a Cisco switch.  They also demonstrate how to enable the use of encryption to protect passwords.
episodes.title: Basic Cisco Device Security

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie continue with securing Cisco devices, focusing on securing network access through the use of SSH.  They demonstrate that data can be seen on the wire if this traffic is not secured.  The discuss and demonstrate how to setup SSH access on the switch.  Then demonstrate using Wireshark, the difference when using SSH to access the device.
episodes.title: Basic Cisco Device Security Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss basic port security when setting up and deploying a device for production.  They describe what a VLAN is and why it's used in security.  Using the Cisco switch, they describe the default configuration of the switchport which allows devices to plug in immediately and work. They also show how to implement the most basic port security using VLANs and shutting down ports.  Lastly, they demonstrate how to use tftp to upload a newer Cisco IOS to the switch from the tftp server.
episodes.title: Basic Cisco Device Security Part 3
